newsitem.title: USA: Amer Power sees 20-25 pct '97 rev growth.
newsitem.headline: Amer Power sees 20-25 pct '97 rev growth.

text.p: American Power Conversion Corp said Monday that it expects to generate revenue growth in the 20 to 25 percent range for 1997.

The company earlier reported record sales and earnings for the quarter and the year ended December 31, 1996. Sales for the fourth quarter rose 48 percent to $210.1 million from $141.5 million a year ago. Earnings for the fourth quarter surged 80 percent to $30.2 million, or $0.32 per share, from $16.8 million, or $0.18 per share, in the year-ago period.

Sales for the year rose 37 percent to $706.9 million from $515.3 million in 1995. Earnings for the year rose 33 percent to $92.4 million, or $0.98 per share, from $69.5 million, or $0.74 per share in 1995.

"1996 was a very successful year for APC," said Rodger Dowdell, president and chief executive officer. "The entire APC team remained very focused on both the financial and operational goals we had set for the year. A renewed sales and marketing emphasis on the server market, as well as progressive process improvements implemented throughout the year enabled the company to maximize the benefits from the product and market investments we made in 1995."
